doc.title: Shanghai Industrial (0363.HK)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Shanghai Industrial 0363.HK Solid Cash Cows with Stable Dividends Transfer of Coverage Solid Cash Cows with Stable Divid_2025-08-31

passages.text: Solid Cash Cows with Stable Dividends; Transfer of Coverage

We like Shanghai Industrial for its cash cows in Infrastructure (mainly toll roads) and Consumer (mainly Nanyang Tobacco). In 1H25, its toll road business delivered largely stable performance with steady growth YoY in traffic volume \((+2\%)\) and toll revenue \((+5\%)\) . Despite the tightening global tobacco- control policies and intensified competition, Nanyang Tobacco appears to demonstrate resilience. With a declining net debt ratio (60.99% by end- 1H25) and proceeds re: disposal of Canvest, we believe Shanghai Industrial will be able to maintain at least a flat FY25E DPS of HK\$0.94, implying a \(6 - 7\%\) yield. Reflecting the latest market values of its listed subsidiaries, we raise our TP from HK\$13.45 to HK\$16.80, after applying the same target discount of \(56\%\) (still \(\sim 1\) S.D. discount to historical mean) and rolling our valuation to FY26E. Maintain Buy. With this report, we transfer coverage of Shanghai Industrial from George Choi to Timothy Chau.

1H25 Results - Shanghai Industrial reported 1H25 net profit of HK\$1,042m \((- 13\%\) YoY). The profit decline was mainly due to: (i) RMB754m net loss at SI Development (vs. net loss of RMB\$177m in 1H24) owing to recognition of impairment losses; (ii) HK\$492m net loss at SI Urban Development (vs. net loss of HK\$232m in 1H24) due to the decrease in property sales; and (iii) the \(12\%\) YoY profit decline at Infrastructure and Environmental Protection attributable to the absence of profit contribution of the disposed Hangzhou Bay Bridge (by end- 2024) and the HK\$56.84m loss recorded as a result from the disposal of equity interest in Canvest Environmental in late May- 25. This was partially offset by the strong performance at (i) Nanyang Tobacco (net profit \(+20\%\) YoY) driven by \(+31\%\) YoY sales volume; and at (ii) Wing Fat Printing (net profit \(+47\%\) YoY) from streamlined business and cost structures, as well as enhanced operational efficiency. The Board declared an interim DPS of HK\$0.42 (1H24: HK\$0.42), implying a dividend payout of \(- 44\%\) (1H24: \(- 38\%\) ).

Key Takeaways from Earnings Call & Announcement - Management highlights the HK\$4bn cash recovered following the sold Canvest shares and exchangeable bonds. Management anticipates marginal improvement in the property sector in 2H25E, driven by the central government's economic- stabilization policies. At Nanyang Tobacco, the company plans to accelerate the application and implementation of intelligent technologies to enhance growth and strengthen its risk control. Wing Fat Printing should continue expanding markets through external collaborations while reducing cost and enhancing efficiencies.
Source: Powered by dataCentral

Contract sales in 1H25 was -RMB290m (with GFA of 13,400 sqm). Properties delivered in 1H25 mainly included Belle Rive in Qingpu, the Metropolis in Suzhou and Sea Palace in Quanzhou. Rental income was -RMB200m. By end-1H25, the company had five projects under construction with a combined area of -392,800 sqm. - Net loss for SI Urban Development amounted to HK$492m (vs. net loss of HK$232m in 1H24). The decline was mainly attributable to the decrease in gross profits from property sales. Contract sales fell 70% YoY to -RMB689m (with GFA of 41,000 sqm). Properties delivered amounted to -HK$1,349m with GFA of -57,000 sqm. They mainly included Ocean One in Shanghai, Summitopia in Tianjin, Felicity Mansion in Yantai, Ocean Times in Shanghai, Originally in Xi’an. By end-1H25, six projects were under construction covering an area of 906,000 sqm.Infrastructure1,7541,825-4%- Toll revenue saw YoY increase across all three expressways with a 2% combined increase YoY in traffic flow. However, the profit contribution for the segment was largely flat YoY. - The Hangzhou Bay Bridge profit was no longer shared following the completion of the disposal of its equity interest by end-2024. - SIIIC Environment Holdings reported net profit of RMB344m (+7% YoY). The increase was primarily driven by its optimization of financing structure which resulted in a 12.5% YoY decrease in financial expenses. During 1H25, two sewage projects were secured with a planned treatment capacity of 60k tonnes per day and 25k tonnes per day respectively. An O&amp;M project was commenced with a planned treatment capacity of 100k tonnes per day. Three upgrading and expansion projects were completed and commenced with a combined planned treatment capacity of 61k tonnes per day. An extension of existing project was granted with a planned treatment capacity of 80k tonnes per day.Consumer48541716%- Profit after tax of Nanyang Tobacco increased 20% YoY, mainly due to its 31% YoY increase in sales volume. This was partially offset by the YoY declined in sales in the duty-paid markets of Hong Kong and Macau. Purchase-curb policies imposed by customs also led to sales volumes decline in duty-free markets of Mainland China, Hong Kong and Macau. - The profit of Wing Fat Printing increased 47% YoY, due to (i) streamlined business and cost structures, and (ii) improved operational efficiency at core factories.Core Operating Profit1,5562,519-38%Net Unallocated Corporate Income/ (Expense)13122488%Finance Costs(875)(1,030)-15%- Net debt ratio decreased to 60.99% (FY24: 65.12%)Share of Results of Associates and JCEs396497-20%Gain on disposal of subsidiaries/ interests in associates(43)52N/A- A loss of HK$56.84m was recorded as a result from the disposal of equity interest in Canvest Environmental in late May-25Profit before Taxation1,1652,059-43%Income Tax(377)(651)-42%Minority Interests254(208)N/AReported Profit1,0421,201-13%

On 22 July 2022 Canvest Environmental and an offer jointly announced that, subject to satisfaction of certain conditions precedent, the offeror would propose the privatization of the company to the shareholders of Canvest Environmental by way of a general offer, at a cancellation price of HK\$4.90 per share. The privatization proposal was approved by the independent shareholders at the Cayman Islands Court Meeting and the extraordinary general meeting of the company on 12 May 2025.

All of the 475,251,000 shares in Canvest Environmental indirectly held by the company were cancelled at HK\$4.90 per share, resulting in total proceeds of \(\sim HK\$ 2,329m\) . Exchangeable bonds the company subscribed with a principal amount of HK\$1,637m were redeemed early due to the privatization of Canvest Environmental. The sum of the principal, accrued interest and early redemption compensation amounted to approximately HK\$1,700 million.

Reflecting the 1H25 results, the latest operating trends and the latest RMBHKD exchange rates, we keep our FY25E earnings forecast unchanged but trim our FY26- 27E earnings forecasts by \(1\%\) .

Direction: Upside Duration: Within 90 Days Category: Macro fundamentals

Supportive government policies like the recent easing of home- buying restriction and reduction of mortgage rate for second- home buyers in Shanghai in late- Aug could stimulate demand and in turns benefit developers such as Shanghai Industrial.
Spread 35pp Current Price and expected returns (upside/downside) as of 29 Aug 2025
Tobacco sales price and volume growth \(10\%\) higher than our forecast

Target discount at 1 S.D. discount to historical mean of \(33\%\) WACC for toll roads at \(11\%\) ; \(1\%\) growth in tobacco price and \(3\%\) for volume Listed subsidiaries are valued at market prices
WACC for toll roads at \(16\%\)

Shanghai Industrial (SIHL) is the window company of the Shanghai government. It was incorporated in January 1996 and listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong on May 30 the same year. Shanghai Industrial Investment Holdings (SII), wholly- owned by the Shanghai government, is the controlling shareholder with a \(57\%\) stake. As the flagship in the SIIC group of companies, SIHL has secured a number of attractive investment opportunities in Shanghai with full support from parent company in past years. It used to own a diversified business portfolio, including infrastructure, healthcare, automotive, dairy products, supermarkets and etc. However, the business focus was unclear and changed over the years. In 2006- 07, SIHL identified property, infrastructure, and consumer sectors as its strategic focus. Since 2008, SIHL has divested a number of non- core assets including healthcare, IT, supermarkets, and Bright Dairy. At the same time, it acquired Shanghai Industrial Development and Shanghai Industrial Urban Development (SIUD) as its property business arms.

We rate Shanghai Industrial shares Buy with a target price of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 16.80\) . We view Shanghai Industrial as an attractive defensive shelter amid the current volatile environment given its core operations in defensive segments: infrastructure and consumer products.

We derive our target price for Shanghai Industrial of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 16.80\) by applying a \(\sim 56\%\) discount to our 2026E NAV of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 38.10\) . The \(56\%\) discount is equivalent to \(\sim 1.5\) . Discount to its long- term historical mean discount. The 1 S.D. discount we apply is consistent with what we do to most conglomerates under our coverage when deriving target prices. We use NAV as our primary valuation method, as this acts as a proxy for book value, adjusting for changes in value of listed assets and revaluing unlisted assets to proxy their listed peers.

Downside risks to our target price for Shanghai Industrial include: 1) If the government implements more austerity measures, demand for housing could dampen and the group could suffer. 2) Asset injections from its parent at high valuations could be value destroying.

Upside risks that could mean the shares outperform our TP include: 1) A large portion of the group's earnings is tied to economic development in Shanghai. 2) The State Council recently approved the setting up of the Shanghai Free- Trade Zone (SFTZ). This could potentially lead to significant appreciation in Shanghai asset prices.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks.
Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

**Investment Ratings:** Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "–" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near-term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over-ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer-term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings-distribution-disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution-disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share-price movement will not materialize as expected.
